member.name: T:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowStyle.NativeMethods
member.summary: Platform Invocation methods (P/Invoke), access unmanaged code. This class does not suppress stack walks for unmanaged code permission. must not be applied to this class. This class is for methods that can be used anywhere because a stack walk will be performed. MSDN Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms182161.aspx

member.name: M:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowStyle.NativeMethods.FindWindow(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the top-level window whose class name and window name match the specified strings. This function does not search child windows. This function does not perform a case-sensitive search. To search child windows, beginning with a specified child window, use the FindWindowEx function. MSDN Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms633499%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
member.param: The class name. If this parameter is NULL, it finds any window whose title matches the lpWindowName parameter.
The window name (the window's title). If this parameter is NULL, all window names match.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the window that has the specified class name and window name. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowStyle.NativeMethods.FindWindowEx(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to a window whose class name and window name match the specified strings. The function searches child windows, beginning with the one following the specified child window. This function does not perform a case-sensitive search. MSDN Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms633500%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
member.param: A handle to the parent window whose child windows are to be searched. If hwndParent is NULL, the function uses the desktop window as the parent window. The function searches among windows that are child windows of the desktop.

A handle to a child window. The search begins with the next child window in the Z order. The child window must be a direct child window of hwndParent, not just a descendant window. If hwndChildAfter is NULL, the search begins with the first child window of hwndParent.
The window name (the window's title). If this parameter is NULL, all window names match.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the window that has the specified class and window names. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowStyle.NativeMethods.GetWindowThreadProcessId(System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the identifier of the thread that created the specified window and, optionally, the identifier of the process that created the window. MSDN Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms633522%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
member.returns: The identifier of the thread that created the window.

member.name: M:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowStyle.SetWindowStyle(System.IntPtr,StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowStyle.WindowStyles)
member.summary: Set the state of a window by an HWND.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds, false otherwise.

member.name: M:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowStyle.SetWindowStyle(System.String,StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowStyle.WindowStyles,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the state of a window by a process name.
member.param: If set to false, only the first process instance will be processed.

member.param: A handle to the parent window whose child windows are to be searched. If hwndParent is NULL, the function uses the desktop window as the parent window. The function searches among windows that are child windows of the desktop.

member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowState.WindowState.Normal
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowState.WindowState.ShowMinimized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowState.WindowState.Maximize
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowState.WindowState.ShowMaximized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowState.WindowState.ShowNoActivate
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to , except the window is not actived.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowState.WindowState.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowState.WindowState.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowState.WindowState.ShowMinNoActive
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowState.WindowState.ShowNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowState.WindowState.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowState.WindowState.ShowDefault
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_* value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32.Helpers.SetWindowState.WindowState.ForceMinimize
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

members.member:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control should avoid unwanted flickering effects.
If , this will avoid any flickering effect on the control, however, it will also have a negative impact by slowing down the responsiveness of the control about to 30% slower.
This negative impact doesn't affect to the performance of the application itself, just to the performance of this control.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A value that indicates whether the control should avoid unwanted flickering effects.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets the required creation parameters when the control handle is created.
The information returned by the property is used to pass information about the initial state and appearance of this control, at the time an instance of this class is being created.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The creation parameters.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the control should avoid unwanted flickering effects.
If , this will avoid any flickering effect on the control, however, it will also have a negative impact by slowing down the responsiveness of the control about to 30% slower.
This negative impact doesn't affect to the performance of the application itself, just to the performance of this control.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A value that indicates whether the control should avoid unwanted flickering effects.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: Specifies a window that accepts drag-drop files.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Specifies a window that has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_COMPOSITED
member.summary: Specifies a window that paints all descendants in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. This cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC. This style is not supported in Windows 2000.
member.remarks: With WS_EX_COMPOSITED set, all descendants of a window get bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. Bottom-to-top painting order allows a descendent window to have translucency (alpha) and transparency (color-key) effects, but only if the descendent window also has the WS_EX_TRANSPARENT bit set. Double-buffering allows the window and its descendents to be painted without flicker.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Specifies a window that includes a question mark in the title bar. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message. The child window should pass the message to the parent window procedure, which should call the WinHelp function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The Help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the child window. WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP cannot be used with the WS_MAXIMIZEBOX or WS_MINIMIZEBOX styles.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: Specifies a window which contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation. If this style is specified, the dialog manager recurses into children of this window when performing navigation operations such as handling the TAB key, an arrow key, or a keyboard mnemonic.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: Specifies a window that has a double border.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: Specifies a window that is a layered window. This cannot be used for child windows or if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: Specifies a window with the horizontal origin on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left. The shell language must support reading-order alignment for this to take effect.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: Specifies a window that has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Specifies a window with the vertical scroll bar (if present) to the left of the client area. The shell language must support reading-order alignment for this to take effect.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: Specifies a window that displays text using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: Specifies a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Specifies a top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it. The system does not bring this window to the foreground when the user minimizes or closes the foreground window. The window does not appear on the taskbar by default. To force the window to appear on the taskbar, use the WS_EX_APPWINDOW style. To activate the window, use the SetActiveWindow or SetForegroundWindow function.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: Specifies a window which does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: Specifies that a child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOREDIRECTIONBITMAP
member.summary: The window does not render to a redirection surface. This is for windows that do not have visible content or that use mechanisms other than surfaces to provide their visual.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Specifies an overlapped window.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: Specifies a palette window, which is a modeless dialog box that presents an array of commands.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: Specifies a window that has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. The shell language must support reading-order alignment for this to take effect. Using the WS_EX_RIGHT style has the same effect as using the SS_RIGHT (static), ES_RIGHT (edit), and BS_RIGHT/BS_RIGHTBUTTON (button) control styles.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Specifies a window with the vertical scroll bar (if present) to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: Specifies a window that displays text using right-to-left reading-order properties. The shell language must support reading-order alignment for this to take effect.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: Specifies a window with a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: Specifies a window that is intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: Specifies a window that should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Specifies a window that should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted. The window appears transparent because the bits of underlying sibling windows have already been painted. To achieve transparency without these restrictions, use the SetWindowRgn function.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.Win32FX.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies a window that has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: T:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState
member.summary: Sets the state of a window.

member.name: T:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.NativeMethods
member.summary: Platform Invocation methods (P/Invoke), access unmanaged code. This class does not suppress stack walks for unmanaged code permission. must not be applied to this class. This class is for methods that can be used anywhere because a stack walk will be performed. MSDN Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms182161.aspx

member.name: M:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.NativeMethods.FindWindow(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the top-level window whose class name and window name match the specified strings. This function does not search child windows. This function does not perform a case-sensitive search. To search child windows, beginning with a specified child window, use the FindWindowEx function. MSDN Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms633499%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
member.param: The class name. If this parameter is NULL, it finds any window whose title matches the lpWindowName parameter.
The window name (the window's title). If this parameter is NULL, all window names match.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the window that has the specified class name and window name. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.NativeMethods.FindWindowEx(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to a window whose class name and window name match the specified strings. The function searches child windows, beginning with the one following the specified child window. This function does not perform a case-sensitive search. MSDN Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms633500%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
member.param: A handle to the parent window whose child windows are to be searched. If hwndParent is NULL, the function uses the desktop window as the parent window. The function searches among windows that are child windows of the desktop.

A handle to a child window. The search begins with the next child window in the Z order. The child window must be a direct child window of hwndParent, not just a descendant window. If hwndChildAfter is NULL, the search begins with the first child window of hwndParent.
The window name (the window's title). If this parameter is NULL, all window names match.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the window that has the specified class and window names. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.NativeMethods.GetWindowThreadProcessId(System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the identifier of the thread that created the specified window and, optionally, the identifier of the process that created the window. MSDN Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms633522%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
member.returns: The identifier of the thread that created the window.

member.name: M:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.NativeMethods.ShowWindow(System.IntPtr,StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState)
member.summary: Sets the specified window's show state. MSDN Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms633548%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
member.param: Controls how the window is to be shown.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds, false otherwise.

member.name: T:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState
member.summary: Controls how the window is to be shown. MSDN Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms633548%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.Hide
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.Normal
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.ShowMinimized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.Maximize
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.ShowMaximized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.ShowNoActivate
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to , except the window is not actived.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.ShowMinNoActive
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.ShowNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.ShowDefault
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_* value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState.ForceMinimize
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: M:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.SetWindowState(System.IntPtr,StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState)
member.summary: Set the state of a window by an HWND.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds, false otherwise.

member.name: M:StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.SetWindowState(System.String,StrelyCleannerPro.SetWindowState.WindowState,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the state of a window by a process name.
member.param: If set to false, only the first process instance will be processed.

member.summary: instance to retrieve the elapsed time.

member.summary: instance to retrieve the remaining time.

member.summary: instance that updates the elapsed and remaining times and raises the events.

member.summary: Indicates wheter the instance has finished to measure intervals.

member.summary: The update interval

member.summary: Specifies the current state of a instance.

member.summary: The instance is running and measuring time intervals.

member.summary: Occurs when the elapsed time finishes.

member.summary: Contains the arguments.

member.summary: Gets or sets the hour.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minute.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Second.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Millisecond.

member.summary: Starts the time interval measurement from zero.

member.summary: Stops the time interval measurement.

member.summary: Resumes the time interval measurement.

member.summary: Stops Time intervals and resets the elapsed and remaining time to zero.
